newsitem.title: CHINA: China approves 1.0 bln yuan in Three Gorges bonds.
newsitem.headline: China approves 1.0 bln yuan in Three Gorges bonds.

text.p: China's State Planning Commission has approved the issue of 1.0 billion yuan ($120 million) in domestic bonds to finance the giant Three Gorges Dam project, the Xinhua news agency said on Thursday.
The corporate bonds would be issued by the the China Yangtze Three Gorges Development Corp, Xinhua said.
The issue, which Xinhua called the first by the Three Gorges corporation inside China, had been rated AAA- by the China Chengxin Securities Rating Co.
The bonds were classified as corporate bonds for enterprises directly run by the central authorities, the agency said but gave no details of when they would be issued or how they would be priced.

Three Gorges Development Corp would guarantee the bonds in full value with a special construction fund set aside for the huge water control and hydro-power project on China's mighty Yangtze River, Xinhua said but without elaborating.
"Raising funds through issuing bonds fits perfectly well into a large project like the Three Gorges Water Project," Xinhua quoted an unnamed expert as saying.
"Pooling funds directly from the market is an important guarantee for the smooth construction of the Three Gorges Project," the expert said.

The project, which officials say will cost 90 billion yuan at fixed current prices and will be finished in about 20 years, was expected to be produce a huge return during the later stages of construction, it said.
